result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph D Steeger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The fine is $1179.00 due 60 days or pay plan.

$65.00 municipal blood draw due 60 days or pay plan.

DNA surcharge of $200.00 due 60 days or pay plan.

Huber granted pursuant to WI. Stat. 303.08  Good Time granted.
Consecutive to: To jail in 15CM521.
and comply with all treatment recommendations.

records.addlTxt:
Cases called: 15CF521 & 16CF62, Defendant, Joseph D Steeger, appeared pro se. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney recited. Defendant waived.  Waiver of preliminary hearing waived. Reading waived on Information. Rights & elements recited. Defendant plead no contest to count 1 in 16CF62 and ct. 1 in 15CF521. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence on ct. 1 in  16CF62: 45 days jail, consecutive to jail in 15CF521. Good time granted. Huber granted pursuant to WI. Stat. 303.08  $1,379 fine, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. $65 blood draw fee. 15 month revocation, 15 month IID. Submit DNA sample. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Bailjumping in 16CF62 read in and dismissed.  In 16CF62, two days jail credit granted. 
In 15CF521, 2 yr. probation, conditions: review in 9 months, 60 days jail to commence April 15, 2016 at 7 p.m. Huber granted pursuant to WI. Stat. 303.08, $518 costs. Complete AODA and follow all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. No jail credit.
standard felony conditions, absolute sobriety, not operate motor vehicle w/out valid D.L.

Defendant Joseph D Steeger in court, in custody by video with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives reading of complaint, right to atty recited, $500.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions, absolute sobriety, not operate w/out valid D.L., waives time limits to prelim,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 02:40 pm.  Return date scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
